It was supposed to be a peaceful hike. Ethan and Emma had been best friends for years, sharing countless adventures and stories. They'd explored forests, climbed mountains, and wandered through valleysâ€”nothing had ever scared them. That is, until they decided to hike the Hollow Path.

The Hollow Path was a trail known among locals for its eerie history. Legends spoke of strange disappearances, of people whoâ€™d ventured deep into the forest and never returned. But these were just stories, Emma thought, as she adjusted her backpack and grinned at Ethan, who was already ahead on the path, his headlamp flickering in the gathering twilight.

"Come on, slowpoke!" Ethan called back to her.

"Give me a second," Emma said, looking around. The trees surrounding them were thick and twisted, their branches gnarled and reaching like skeletal hands. The air was thick with the smell of damp earth and rotting leaves.

The sun had already begun setting, but they were only about an hour into their hike. Theyâ€™d planned to reach the old cabin before dark, but Emma couldnâ€™t shake the feeling that something was off. She pushed the thought aside. It was just the woodsâ€”people got spooked by them all the time.

Ethan was already ahead, his headlamp casting eerie shadows on the trees. As she caught up, Emma noticed something strange. The path was narrow, bordered by high, dense trees that seemed to press in on them. The wind had picked up, rustling the leaves, but there were no birds. No insects. Just an unsettling silence.

"Hey, Ethan, have you noticed how quiet it is?" Emma asked.

Ethan looked over his shoulder, a slight frown on his face. "Yeah. Itâ€™s too quiet. But it's probably just the storm rolling in."

Emma nodded, but she couldnâ€™t shake the feeling that something wasnâ€™t right.

As the path narrowed further, the trees seemed to grow darker, the shadows longer. Emma reached for her phone to check the time, but it was dead. Strange. She had charged it before they left.

"We should be close," Ethan said, more to himself than to Emma. "The cabin's just up ahead."

They continued walking, the eerie quiet growing more oppressive by the second. The air had turned cold, a chill that cut through their jackets. Emma shivered, pulling her coat tighter around her.

"Do you hear that?" Emma asked, her voice trembling slightly. She stopped in her tracks.

Ethan glanced back. "What? I donâ€™t hear anything."

"No, listen. It sounds likeâ€”"

A low growl echoed through the trees, followed by the unmistakable sound of twigs snapping under heavy footsteps.

Emma's heart raced. "What the hell was that?"

Ethan's face paled, but he tried to mask his fear with a chuckle. "Probably just a bear or something. Letâ€™s keep moving."

Emma wasnâ€™t so sure. The growl had been too deep, too unnatural. And then there was the way the trees seemed to move around them, as though they were closing in. Her mind raced through every story she had heard about the Hollow Pathâ€”disappearances, strange creatures, and whispers in the night.

"Maybe we should turn back," Emma said, her voice shaking. "This doesnâ€™t feel right."

But before Ethan could respond, the growl came againâ€”closer this time. Louder. And then a rustling in the bushes behind them.

Ethanâ€™s eyes widened. "What the hell is that?"

Before they could react, a shadow darted between the trees. It was quick, almost too quick to see. But it was large. Larger than anything they had seen before. Emma's breath caught in her throat.

"We need to go. Now," Ethan said, grabbing Emmaâ€™s arm.

They turned to run, but the path had changed. The trees, which had once stood tall and firm, were now bent at odd angles, blocking their way. The narrow path was now a maze of thorns and twisted branches. The growling grew louder, closer.

"Run!" Ethan screamed.

They pushed through the thorns, branches tearing at their clothes, but the growling was right behind them. The air was thick with a terrible presence, the very woods seeming to come alive, intent on trapping them. Emma could barely see through the tears in her eyes, her heart pounding in her chest.

Suddenly, Ethan stopped. "Emma, look!" he shouted, his voice filled with terror.

Emma followed his gaze. In the distance, just beyond the twisted trees, stood a figure. It was tall, unnaturally tall, with long, sinewy arms hanging loosely at its sides. Its face was featureless, a dark void where eyes should have been. Its skin was pale, almost translucent, and it seemed to shimmer in the dim light.

"Is thatâ€¦ a person?" Emma whispered, her voice barely a breath.

Ethanâ€™s voice was thick with fear. "Thatâ€™s not a person."

The figure moved, and the earth seemed to tremble with each step. It was getting closer.

"We need to move!" Emma cried.

But as they turned to run, the path before them vanished. There was no way out. They were trapped in the forest, surrounded by darkness and the sound of the creature's growls.

A voice, distant and cold, whispered from the trees. "You shouldnâ€™t have come here."

Ethan and Emma spun around, but no one was there. The voice seemed to come from everywhere at once.

The creature was closer now, its presence overwhelming. It moved with unnatural speed, and before they could react, it was upon them. Its cold, ghostly fingers wrapped around Ethanâ€™s wrist, dragging him toward the void of its face. Ethan screamed, his eyes wide with terror, but Emma could do nothing but watch as he was pulled into the darkness.

"Donâ€™t!" she screamed, reaching out, but her hand passed through the air where he had been.

And then, as quickly as it had all begun, the creature was gone. The growls faded, and the oppressive silence returned. The trees were once again still, and the path, though still dark, seemed almostâ€¦ normal.

But Emma was alone.

Her chest heaved as she tried to make sense of what had just happened. Was it a dream? A nightmare? Had it been real?

A rustling in the bushes behind her broke her thoughts. She spun around, her heart pounding. But there was nothing there.

Nothing but the cold wind, the dense forest, and the empty path.

She was trapped, with no way out.

And then she heard it.

The same growl.

This time, it was coming from behind her.

A story that people think is a hoax or a real thing:
Tons of supernatural events that took place in a London home between 1977 and 1979. The events involved a single mother and her two daughters who reported seeing furniture move and hearing strange noises. 

In August 1977, Peggy Hodgson called the police to her home at *** Green Street in Enfield, London.
Peggy reported seeing furniture moving and her daughters Janet and Margaret hearing knocking sounds.
A police officer reported seeing a chair move by itself.
Other claims included thrown toys, overturned chairs, and children levitating.
More than 30 people, including neighbors, paranormal investigators, and journalists, reported seeing and hearing these events.
Janet Hodgson sits in her home in Green Street, Enfield, on Feb. 17, 1978. Janet would often go into a trance-like state where she would speak in a deep, scratchy voice, claiming to be the ghost of a man named Bill Wilkins, who had died in the house years before.
After a year and a half of activity, the phenomena at the Enfield house abruptly came to an end. No one knew why, but these sorts of hauntings are common with poltergeists: they stop, they start, and the family gets back to normal.
Then the story was covered in the Daily Mirror newspaper until 1979.

This all started from an Ouija Board.

The story is called "The Enfield Poltergeist"

Based on a true story!

In 1912, worlds longest, luxurious ship was launched called RMS TITANIC. It coild carry around 3000 passengers in it. It was known as "The Ship of Dreams" and it really was. It lights glowing at night showing its beauty. But on that night only something worst happened. The RMS TITANIC was on its Maiden voyage from Southhampton, U.K. to New York, America. It was carrying 1,512 passengers it including the crews. It only had 20 emergency boats because the president declared it as the Unsinkable ship. As it departed from Southampton, the water started flowing beautifully. At night of 14 april time around 11 pm, an Iceberg was saw (Its name was Rehorek Iceberg) and struck it which caused it to sink. Now the was designed that even if 4-5 compartments was filled it water, it would still reach its destination properly, but the iceberg strucked the ship so hard that it filled 6 compartments which caused its bow to sink. At the night 1 am, its backside came up from the water. And 12 mins after it was pulled up, the ship broke into 2 pieces and while its backside was coming down, it killed many people with its fans that help it to move. At around 2 am it fully sank. Only 512 people were saved by RMS CARPATHIA. The RMS CARPATHIA came around 4 am after receiving distress signal from RMS TITANIC. But the others, sadly passed away. . . Rest In Peace, RMS TITANIC  and the others who passed away in this worst sinking in the history. . .

True story: In 2014, a family bought their dream home in Westfield, New Jersey. It was a beautiful six-bedroom house, perfect for raising their children. But before they could even move in, strange letters began arriving in their mailbox.

The first letter was polite but unsettling. It was from someone calling themselves The Watcher. The letter claimed the house had been watched for decades, and now it was the family's turn to be observed.

Then the letters got worse. The Watcher knew the familyâ€™s names, the layout of the house, even where their children slept. One letter asked: "Do you know whatâ€™s in the walls? Have they told you yet?" Another said: "I am pleased to know your names now, and the names of the young blood you have brought me."

The family never spent a single night in the house. Terrified, they tried to sell it, but rumors spread, and no one wanted it. To this day, the identity of The Watcher remains unknown, and the house still stands, waitingâ€¦ watching.

A hiker decided to go on a hike by himself. Something he was not very used to. The whole day was normal. Trees and bushes engulfed his surroundings. He enjoyed being outdoors in the mountains. Nothing seemed strange to him, that was until he was making his way back to his car. He figured an eight hour hike was good enough. The sky was already getting dark and he needed to get back, fast. What was odd was how much he didnâ€™t recognize the trail back. He began to panic.

Night had already taken over and all he had was a flashlight and no clue on how to get back. He knew it was already too late and too dangerous to keep going through the perilous forest. He began to worry that he would have no shelter for the night when almost luckily enough, he stumbled across a broken-down cabin. It was dark, and seemed like no one had visited it in years, but he knew it was the only place where he could rest until daylight, especially since his flashlight was running out of battery. He knocked on the door a few times but no one answered, so he let himself in where strangely enough, a perfect bed fitted for one person awaited him in the center. He knew that if the owner came back he could explain himself, he was sure that the owner wouldnâ€™t mind, or was even probably dead. So he went ahead and got himself comfortable in bed. As he tried to sleep, he couldnâ€™t ignore the collection of paintings around the room; portraits of strange looking people all peering at him, each wearing a smile that sent chills up his spine. Not too long after his  exhaustion from the hike got the best of him and he was able to ignore the faces.

The next morning he got up early and was shocked to see that there were no paintings around the room, but windowsâ€¦

the seemingly normal town of Ohio, a viral dance trend centered around the catchy "Skibidi" tune takes a dark turn when a group of friends discovers an old, disused public restroom known as the "Skibidi Toilet." Legend has it that anyone who attempts to perform the Skibidi dance in front of the toilet invokes the spirit of the Rizzler, a mischievous entity that feeds on charisma and charm. When one of the friends, a social media influencer known for his "W Rizz," challenges the rest to film a TikTok in front of the haunted restroom, they unwittingly awaken the Rizzler. As they start to experience bizarre occurrencesâ€”distorted reflections in the toilet, eerie laughter, and glimpses of Freddy Fazbear lurking in the shadowsâ€”their friendship begins to unravel. One by one, they are "Fanum'd," transformed into uncanny versions of themselves, losing their charm and personalities while becoming trapped in the Backrooms, a liminal space filled with endless hallways and flickering lights. Desperate to escape, the remaining friends must navigate this nightmarish maze, solve cryptic clues related to the Skibidi dance, and confront their deepest fears. They soon realize that the key to breaking the curse lies not just in their moves but in confronting their hidden insecurities and the true meaning of friendship. *Twist:* As they finally face the Rizzler in a terrifying showdown, they discover that the Rizzler is a twisted reflection of their own desires for popularity and validation. To escape the Backrooms and reclaim their identities, they must embrace their true selves rather than the facades they've built online. In the end, they learn that true connection comes from authenticity, and as they dance their way back to reality, they make a pact to keep their lives free from the superficial allure of social media fame. But as they leave the restroom, a shadow lingers, hinting that the curse of the Skibidi Toilet may not be entirely vanquished.

One stormy night, a young traveler seeking shelter stumbled upon the mansion's looming silhouette. Ignoring the warnings, he stepped inside, the creaking door closing behind him. As he explored the dark corridors, he felt an icy chill ğŸ¥¶ and heard faint whispers in the wind.

The coffin on wheels:
Long ago, somewhere in russia, in a lonely neighborhood, there was a spoiled girl even tho her family was poor. Once she turned 16, her parents decided to work abroad so they could afford the bills. They left at 6 pm, and it started to get dark. The girl decided to get ice cream even though her parents didn't allow her, and she sat on the couch to watch TV. Shortly after, the TV kept switching into blank channels, and the girl thought it could be a problem with the signal, so she didn't mind at all. Next time, it switched channels again, and this time, it wrote on the screen, "I am heading towards you", the girl didn't mind at all. After a while, it switched again. This time, it said her address. The girl thought it would be some kind of joke, so she continued to watch her favorite channel. The next time it switched, it said, "i am on street 273" which was a couple of miles away. She didn't mind... next time, it switched and said, "I am in your neighborhood." The girl started to get worried since it had just been a few minutes, and the tv won't stop switching to unknown channels.. As the girl finished her 5th ice cream box, she cuddled her favorite toy. The TV switched again and said, "i am in your stairway", the girl decided to switch off the TV and hide behind the couch. The tv turned on... The girl held her breath as she heard her apartment door opening. The TV proceeded to say, " I am in your apartment." She decided to close her eyes as she heard some wheels screeching and bumping into tables. then she felt some tension beside her, but she dared not to look, and the TV said,'I found you..." The girl looked rapidly to the side as the coffin attacked her and said,"I got your heart"

The Whispers in the Walls

In a quiet village, there was an old, creepy house that no one wanted to go near. People said it was haunted by a family that disappeared long ago. One stormy night, Aria and her friends dared each other to spend the night inside.

As soon as they entered, strange whispers started coming from the walls. The whispers called out, "Lila... Lila..." They followed the sound and found a locked door. When they opened it, there was a dusty mirror inside. The mirror showed the reflection of a family looking scared, trapped inside.

Suddenly, the whispers turned into loud screams. The door slammed shut, and the room became dark and scary. Aria quickly threw something at the mirror, and it shattered with a loud crash. The trapped spirits were finally freed.

Aria and her friends ran out of the house, never looking back. From that day on, they knew the house wasnâ€™t just a storyâ€”it really was haunted!

A hiker decided to go on a hike by himself. Something he was not very used to. The whole day was normal. Trees and bushes engulfed his surroundings. He enjoyed being outdoors in the mountains. Nothing seemed strange to him, that was until he was making his way back to his car. He figured an eight hour hike was good enough. The sky was already getting dark and he needed to get back, fast. What was odd was how much he didnâ€™t recognize the trail back. He began to panic.
Night had already taken over and all he had was a flashlight and no clue on how to get back. He knew it was already too late and too dangerous to keep going through the perilous forest. He began to worry that he would have no shelter for the night when almost luckily enough, he stumbled across a broken-down cabin. It was dark, and seemed like no one had visited it in years, but he knew it was the only place where he could rest until daylight, especially since his flashlight was running out of battery. He knocked on the door a few times but no one answered, so he let himself in where strangely enough, a perfect bed fitted for one person awaited him in the center. He knew that if the owner came back he could explain himself, he was sure that the owner wouldnâ€™t mind, or was even probably dead. So he went ahead and got himself comfortable in bed. As he tried to sleep, he couldnâ€™t ignore the collection of paintings around the room; portraits of strange looking people all peering at him, each wearing a smile that sent chills up his spine. Not too long after his  exhaustion from the hike got the best of him and he was able to ignore the faces.
The next morning he got up early and was shocked to see that there were no paintings around the room, but windowsâ€¦

Debarking can cause swelling (which can lead to ur dog suffocating bc the throat will swell) bleeding, gagging and coughing which would be extremely painful if ur vocal cords got scraped raw. And barking is part of how dogs communicate. They use it to communicate hunger, discomfort, excitement, and sometimes to alert people of danger. Imagine, if u will, that ur greatest physical asset was ur voice. It's how u communicate ur feelings, it's how u get ur point across, it's how u socialize. Imagine if ur parents thought ur voice was so annoying that instead of teaching u other, nonvocal ways to express urself in certain situations, they decided to pay more money to put u under the knife just to shut u up bc they were too lazy to be a decent person and spend a few hours with u. Now imagine ur a dog who got debarked. If u just so happen to be a very vocal dog like a husky for example, u won't have just lost ur bark, you'll have lost ur entire sense of identity

Unless the dog is cruel (like a psycho eating a baby alive despite being trained and well fed. Yea, every living thing can be evil regardless of how well you raise them) or puts everyone in danger by barking (IDK in what scenario, but I would imagine some shit like the movie where you have to be super silent. In that case, debarking would almost be a must, unless you want your dog and everyone else dead), I don't see a reason why anyone would debark their dogs. Just train them to bark only when needed 'cuz if they bark all the time for no reason, it's like hearing your partner scream into your ear for no reason and you'd eventually slap your partner to get them to stfu, and it'll make their barks meaningless. But if they bark with purpose (seeing a squirrel eating doesn't count), then everyone would know that their barks mean serious business and everyone will attend to the dog when it barks. It's just like having a soft spoken friend who scream and you immediately attend to them vs a screaming annoying karen who you get used to and just ignore overtime.

The sad part? Charlie was probably debarked because he was barking at the dark figure (which kept said dark figure away) in the first place and the owners got tired of it so they debarked the dog. And because they debarked the dog, the dark figure was able to make its move.

The autistic teenager became fixated on his own screaming and started doing it all day, everyday. After three years of constant, 95+ decibel screaming, the family met with a surgeon who performed a reversible procedure to limit (not silence) the volume of the boy's screams - and only his screams. He can still speak and make other sounds perfectly normally. Now that his screams are quieter, the fixation has waned and he screams 90% less often than he used to.

They didn't "debark" him, they didn't cut out his vocal cords. They made his, their, and their other also autistic (and sound sensitive) son's lives better and, if the situation is resolved, they can undo the surgery.

Â @DerpDevilDDÂ  I know the whole story, itâ€™s still cruel and inhumane. They had other options to make him quieter, loads of things exist to absorb sound. The procedure was unnecessary and a violation of autonomy.

I have a border collie australian shepherd mix with the MDR1 gene mutation. It essentially means many medications that are safe for dogs will kill her. We have to be very careful with her so she doesn't get exposed to something which is normally easily treatable, but isn't for her.  The knowledge of that terrible gene mutation for German Shepherds is heartbreaking. That whole story was heartbreaking on both sides. I know what it feels like to have a past you're not proud of - to change yourself and actively decide to become a better person only for that past to come back for you. But i also know what it's like to feel completely alone and one other life/being is keeping you going.  That story just hit hard.
